subject: Design
title: Passive House: Zero-Energy by Design
description: A micro-lesson that makes Passive House: Zero-Energy by Design usable.

hook.text: A Passive House uses 90% less energy for heating than a normal building. No special technology needed â€” just design.

buildup.text: Developed in Germany in 1991, the Passivhaus standard uses super-insulation, airtight construction, and heat recovery.

discovery.text: Body heat from occupants and warmth from appliances provide most of the heating. The building traps it.

twist.text: Passive Houses cost only 5-10% more to build but save thousands per year in energy bills for decades.

climax.text: The cheapest energy is energy you never use. Passive design is the ultimate sustainable architecture strategy.

punchline.text: The greenest building isn't high-tech. It's well-insulated.

quiz.question: How does a Passive House achieve 90% energy reduction?
options: Super-insulation, airtight construction, and heat recovery ventilation
